Ankou are undead monsters found on the fourth level of the Stronghold of Security and in the Wilderness Crater. They are described by the Slayer Master Vannaka as "neither skeleton nor ghost, but a combination of both."

Ankou are weak against Earth spells and the Salve amulet. In free worlds, they are often attacked because of their high experience yield and decent drops, although some players will kill them solely for their left skull half drops. In combat, ankou act similar to attackable human NPCs by punching their opponents.

The ankou is the only monster to drop the left skull half, a component needed to assemble the skull sceptre. Wearing Varrock armour while killing them increases the chance of receiving this component of the skull sceptre.

When killing ankou, an elite version may spawn (guaranteed while on a Slayer assignment), the chance of which can be further increased with the use of fellstalk incense sticks.

Ankou only drop ghost hunter equipment and Cremation in members' worlds, unlike ghosts and revenants that can drop them in free worlds. [1]

These items are dropped alongside main drops.

Achievement[edit | edit source]

  • Guardian of the Realm ( 0) – Obtained a collection of unique drops from Slayer monsters located within Asgarnia & Misthalin.
    • Left skull half drop

Update history[edit | edit source]

This information has been compiled as part of the update history project. Some updates may not be included – see here for how to help out!
  • patch 12 February 2024 (Update):
    • Rebalanced several low level monsters that were harder to kill than intended
  • patch 17 April 2023 (Update):
    • Fixed the issue of incorrect souls being captured by Ushabti.
  • patch 11 April 2023 (Update):
    • Can be killed as part of the new undead slayer task.
  • hotfix 9 October 2017 (Update):
    • The drop rate of mystic cloth from ankou has been reduced.
  • update 4 July 2006 (Update):
    • Added to game.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • In Breton mythology, the ankou is a personification of death. The word ankou in the Breton language means Grim Reaper.
  • Although the examine info says, "A bony ghost." they do not count towards a Slayer assignment of ghosts. Instead, they are a Slayer task by themselves while also counting towards skeleton assignments.
  • They used to be located in the Forinthry Dungeon, but were replaced by dark beasts on 8 August 2016 as part of the Wilderness Improvements update.
  • Due to excessive botting, ankou had their health boosted. This led to player complaints as the ankou then had too many life points for low-levelled players. The boost was eventually reverted with the update on 17 October 2016.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Jagex. Mod Stu's Twitter account. 18 September 2018. (Archived from the original on 30 October 2019.) Mod Stu: "I had a quick look at the ankou death scripts (including elites) to confirm. They only drop Cremation/herb-burner/ghosthunter/essence on member worlds. The above ninja fix requested only ghosts, and ankou aren't classified as ghosts (they have a distinct Slayer category)."
  2. ^ Jagex. Mod Stu's Twitter account. 17 November 2017. (Archived from the original on 22 January 2019.) Mod Stu: "Had a look at the code: * It only drops on member worlds * Looks like a 1/1,000 drop chance, no modifiers * It just flags a variable and messages "You have unlocked the ability to burn bones on bonfires!", so it's easy to miss you've unlocked it"
